law.catch_line: CONFINEMENT OF ANIMALS WITH HISTORY OF BITING PEOPLE.

section.text: All fierce, dangerous or vicious animals, including dogs that have a history of unlawful biting of humans, shall be confined by the owner within a building or secure enclosure or by the animal control warden in the animal control shelter. Such animals shall not be released from confinement unless securely muzzled. (Code 1959 , §4-41)
